summary: Email chain from August 2019 between Katherine Rodi of the NYC Department of Education and an FBI agent regarding a suspicious substitute teacher at Talent Unlimited High School. Rodi raises concerns about the teacher's background and possible connection to the Epstein case following a press article about a former student being recruited for Epstein near the school.

persons.name: Katherine Rodi
persons.role: Executive Director, Office of Employee Relations, NYC Department of Education
persons.context: Author of the email raising concerns about a suspicious substitute teacher at Talent Unlimited High School and possible connection to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Aaron
persons.context: FBI agent who responds to Rodi's email, acknowledges the information, and copies case agents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of the case; the inquiry is about a possible connection between a substitute teacher and Epstein's recruitment activities.

connections.description: Correspondence regarding a potential investigative lead; Rodi is providing information to the FBI about a suspicious individual.
Rodi raises concerns that the substitute teacher, due to his unusual background and circles, might be connected to Epstein's recruitment activities, prompted by a press article.

events.title: Email Inquiry About Suspicious Teacher
events.description: Katherine Rodi emails the FBI about a substitute teacher at Talent Unlimited High School with a suspicious background, questioning if he is connected to the Epstein case following a press article about Epstein recruitment near the school.

events.title: Initial Inquiry to FBI
events.description: Katherine Rodi initially contacts the FBI to ask if a specific name is on their radar regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case.

locations: NYC Department of Education, 65 Court Street, Brooklyn, NY 11201
keyFacts: A press article on August 15, 2019, reported a former student of Talent Unlimited High School said she was recruited for Jeffrey Epstein near the school.

The NYC Department of Education identified a substitute teacher at the same school with a suspicious background: 'slightly pervy' misconduct history, a life history 'weird' and not typical for a sub, moving in unusual circles, and working in DOE schools since 2005.
Katherine Rodi proactively contacted the FBI to check if this individual was on their radar regarding the Epstein case, indicating internal concerns about a potential link.
The FBI agent (Aaron) acknowledged the inquiry, stated the case was theirs, and copied the case agents, showing the information was passed to the investigative team.
The document reveals a proactive tip from a city education official to federal law enforcement based on a combination of a news report and internal personnel review.
